user-story.i-want: the feed to seamlessly load more videos as I swipe
user-story.so-that: I never hit a dead end while browsing content.

acceptance-criteria.criterion: Cursor-based pagination retrieves 20-item pages by default and gracefully handles backfill when returning to previous videos. [Source: docs/tech-spec-epic-4.md#implementation-guide]

Serverpod feed endpoint enforces max page size 50 and returns `feedSessionId`, `nextCursor`, and `hasMore` fields that the client persists and reuses. [Source: docs/tech-spec-epic-4.md#source-tree--file-directives]
Infinite scroll footer displays loading, error, and end-of-feed states with retry capability and analytics event `feed_pagination_retry`. [Source: docs/tech-spec-epic-4.md#analytics--observability]

**PERFORMANCE CRITICAL**: Pagination must resolve within 350 ms P95 when data cached, 650 ms P95 when cache miss, measured via Datadog RUM spans. [Source: docs/tech-spec-epic-4.md#performance-metrics]
Feed state persists across app restarts (last cursor replay) and handles offline fallback by replaying cached videos when network unavailable. [Source: docs/tech-spec-epic-4.md#implementation-guide]

task.description: Extend `fetch_feed_page_use_case.dart` to send cursor + personalization params, persisting last cursor in secure storage.
Implement `infinite_scroll_footer.dart` widget with loading/error/end visuals and retry callback.
Update `feed_page.dart` BLoC wiring to trigger pagination when 80% scroll threshold reached and to replay cached pages offline.
Update `feed_endpoint.dart` to emit cursor tokens, enforce page limit <=50, and include `feedSessionId`.
Add Redis-backed page cache (`feed:page:{userId}:{cursor}`) with 120-second TTL leveraging `feed_cache_manager.dart`.
Emit Datadog trace spans capturing pagination latency and cache source (hit/miss).
Create `feed_pagination_integration_test.dart` covering cursor flow, offline replay, and error retries.
Fire analytics event `feed_page_loaded` with cursor metadata and latency buckets.
